tool.name: DBKit Create
tool.command: mkdir -p inputs && #for item in $inputs ln -s '${item}' 'inputs/${item.element_identifier}' && #end for dbkit_create.py -l '$input' -p 'inputs' -o '$index' -d '$database' -g '$log' -il '$advanced.idlength' -ic '$advanced.idcase' -ie '$advanced.idextension' -ip '$advanced.idprefix'

param.name: input
param.label: List of Identifiers
param.help: Specify a list containing all entry identifiers to be considered.

param.name: inputs
param.label: Specify your datasets
param.help: The datasets that you want to convert into an ffindex.

param.name: type
param.label: Identifier Formatting Options
param.option: Yes, I want to format my identifiers

param.name: idprefix
param.label: Identifier Prefix
param.help: Specify the prefix of the identifier

validator.message: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores

param.name: idextension
param.label: Identifier Extensions
param.help: Specify the extension of the identifier

validator.message: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores

param.name: idlength
param.label: Identifier Length
param.help: Specify the length of the identifier (disable=0).

param.name: idcase
param.label: Identifier Case
param.help: Choose to format the identifier by changing its case (optional).

tool.help:
**What it does**
This database creation tool creates ffindex/ffdata datatset pairs from collections.
